definition: lit. fence town/buffer region (between enemies)/Tang dynasty system of provincial administration under a provincial governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3]
to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)

sentences.english: In the period of five dynasties and ten states, the military governorship of late Tang dynasty continued to develop.
sentences.chinese: 五代十国时期是唐末藩镇割据的继续和发展。

sentences.english: The Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period is the continuation and development of the Late Tang Dynasty opposite to the splittism.
sentences.chinese: 五代十国时期是唐末藩镇割据的继续和发展。

definition: (of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
foreign invasion/disaster on border due to incursion

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
An Lushan (703-757), Tang general, leader of the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
